intro: Stipa baktashevae, commonly known as the Baktashev's needlegrass, is a species of grass native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showing a high degree of drought tolerance. Its leaves are narrow and坚韧, adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Stipa baktashevae plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptations to extreme environments.
